p: The above evidence attests to the importance of G. ternifolia, C. filiformis, and R. coccinea in traditional African and Western medicine. Unfortunately, despite this frequency of use of these plants for health purposes, it must be noted that rare or nonexistent toxicity tests have explored their safety following long repeated use at different doses. Literature data indicate that the toxicity of medicinal plants can also be established in long-repeated small doses [ 40]. In addition, in traditional medicine, the management of pathologies most often requires the use of medicinal potions over a long period of time.
